setup.question: What is the "new kind of fun" that the narrator wants to have now that his first experiment worked?
answers: He is going to continue developing various types of mutant animals
He is going to sit back and watch a chaotic plan come into place

Text.text: I err B due to the wording - A says he will continue development, but the question quote says this is a new kind of fun, so the chaos seems more of a new avenue for the narrator.

The main character is a scientist who wants to create flying mutants in the basement of his family home.His first experiment were nonflying mutants he called Nijinskys.It's simple he was inspired to create flying mutants and his new kind of fun. He states,
(volpas). Judge B may try discuss his future plans of releasing these mutants but he only devised his plan after his family was more focused on,Guy,

Youre right. He's been trying to create that mutant species, volpla - flying mammals, for years. He then released them from the lab (
). Now he wants to watch chaos ensue from people discovering his mutants:

. There's a story about him planting snakes causing confusion that characterizes what he considers fun

He has also dissembled the lab and killed all the failed experiment mutants
Ending scene is even him literally sitting back:
Might need another round for evidence but it's pretty clear cut
B has a clearer argument but I would like to see more from both sides about what the narrator considers to be fun.
He found making mutants fun but the new kind of fun was always advancing his mutant creations. The next being flying mutants. when his wife asked what
he stated,
because he is excited to design new mutants. He wants to perfect the flying mutants because wants them to be
. Here is quote showing that after successfully winged mutants he was thrilled:
I mention the rocket because the MC only thinks of the plan to release them after witnessing Guy got more attention from his family. His FIRST new kind of fun was creating volpas.

So I've already said that he told his wife the story about "planting snakes as fun", A just opportunistically quoted from the end of that as if it's about the design of new mutants

Here's proof of the story:
Here's proof that the lab was being torn down which would mean he wouldn't be making new mutants:
A's "wants attention" argument makes even less sense. It's a logical fallacy that just bc X happens after Y, Y was caused by X. Plus the scientist was secretive to the end even with family:
A's breaking up of quotations is pretty dicey, and I agree with B that there is a logical fallacy in A's arg.

answers.reason for outcome: A had a bit of a weak strategy to begin with, and B kept poking holes in A's arg

I think this took a while (IRL) but it was only 2 debate rounds. Judge already had good intuition / priors. I setup evidence honest debater well and the dishonest debater made mistakes i pointed out: opportunistically quoted & a logical fallacy
I lost because of the logical fallacy within my speech.
